entry.title: Red Sun
entry.summary:
Author: DiseasedBreeze

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,899Chapters: 7/8Kudos: 404

Summary: The war between Earth and the battle fleet of Krypton has been going on long enough it‚Äôs hard to remember what Earth was like pre-alien invasion. Slade doesn‚Äôt mind that, as one of the metahuman supersoldiers keeping Earth from being totally crushed he gets to enjoy a few little privileges, like having a Kryptonian prisoner for his personal use. He‚Äôs tortured enough aliens over the course of the war to understand how to handle them. Red solar lights, a kryptonite collar and magic chains will keep his new toy secured. He‚Äôs not expected to get much intel out of a low-ranked foot soldier, spared by accident rather than designed. He‚Äôs a gift for Slade to work out the alien‚Äôs weaknesses. There‚Äôs one in particular he‚Äôs looking forward to exploring; Kryptonians are programmed to obey officers. As a human he looks close enough to qualify.

entry.title: Being part of the Kent-Wayne family isn‚Äôt so bad
entry.summary:
Author: PurpleButterfly19

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,529Chapters: 2/39Kudos: 35

Summary: It‚Äôs been three years since Dick and Kori got married, and many things have changed for the Kent-Wayne family. The family grew larger through more adoptions and also biological ties. New soulmates were discovered, more weddings were held, the Justice League can finally put a name to the man behind the cowl, and Wayne Manor will never look the same again. But the greatest change? Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent are officially engaged. This is the story of how they got there. As for Conner? He couldn‚Äôt be doing any better!

entry.title: You can take the boy from the circus
entry.summary:
Author: Gotham_Blight

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 63,548Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 411

Summary: Damian Al-Ghul Wayne had everything at one point. He was a prince. Ibn al Xu'ffasch. Son of the bat. Heir to the demon. He had never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his palace in Nanda Parbat. He had never asked to be shipped to a gloomy, grey city. Even when his father kept taking in orphans and ruining his plans for inheritance, Damian stood steadfast. But then his father died, leaving behind his newest orphan. A tiny acrobat with watery blue eyes and black curls, who spoke no English. Damian knew the boy never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his circus troupe. Damian knew he needed to be there for him.

entry.title: Arisen The Bat
entry.summary:
Author: dexpair

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,172Chapters: 10/71Kudos: 11

Summary: On the streets of a Neo Gotham, old man Bruce Wayne lived his life as quite as possible. No more hero stuff, no more meetings with The League in space. His days were filled with silly conversations with his husband or listening to the dramas of his teenage son. It was an opposite reality to the one he had lived his whole life, but that's what made it special for him. However, on a special day, Bruce discovers that getting rid of his past life wouldn't be so easy. Ghosts from the past have returned, this time haunting his children, and The Dark Knight realizes he will have to act for his city and his family one last time.

entry.title: So This Is How Multiverse Lawsuits Start
entry.summary:
Author: MaskSoully

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,836Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 92

Summary: You‚Äôre fictional,‚Äù Francesca says, already regretting it. Superman stares at her.Batman exhales ‚ÄúI suspected,‚Äù he says.‚ÄúYOU WHAT,‚Äù Francesca shrieks.Bruce Wayne sets her phone on the counter. Her phone. The one she didn't even notice was missing. ‚ÄúThere are films about us.‚ÄùClark goes very, very still.Francesca covers her face with her hands. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry. Don't tell me you went into Twitter,‚Äù Francesca gasps, "Don't tell me you went into Ao3"Bruce quirked his eyebrow in response. "Oh man..."Francesca was just a girl. A normal girl. Definitely a little too online. More enamored with a world filled with superheroes and powers. Worlds she could never touch.Until Superman and Batman appear in her kitchen.Now Francesca is tangled in something much bigger than fandom and fiction: a government conspiracy, impossible technology, and the unsettling realization that these two men didn‚Äôt cross worlds because of a threat in theirs‚ÄîBut because someone in hers figured out how to pull them through.
